page.title: 05BISHOP BURTON COLLEGE FARM
page.content: {Bishop Burton College of Agriculture {Farm}has a wide variety of enterprises including; a{friesian dairy herd; a {pedigree Welsh pig unit; a commercial {pig unit; Texel, Hampshire and {commercial sheep flocks; beef units - {both intensive and semi-intensive and {poultry - capons and turkeys for the {Christmas market.}The farm is run not only to make a profit (very important!), but also to provide a {'working laboratory'}for students at the College. This gives students practical, and managerial experience on a 'real farm'. Because of this the College farmworkers have the additional role of educating students in basic farm duties. The {horticultural unit}reflects the local industry growing salad crops and cut flowers. There is over 25 ha. of managed woodland on the estate.
